bit.value: Custom articles allow you to display your own content on a new article of your helpdesk. When creating a custom article, you can either type out the content you would like to display, insert your own HTML code, or link the article to an external template.

Trellis Desk contains a built-in knowledgebase. A knowledgebase is a collection of pre-written articles designed to help a user find an existing solution to his or her problem, thus eliminating the need to submit a support ticket. You should group similar KB articles into the same category. This will make it easier for users to quickly locate the article that they are looking for.
The category has been successfully updated.
The category has been successfully added.
There are no categories. Would you like to add a category?
There are no sub-categories. Would you like to add a sub-category?
What would you like to do with the articles in this category?

To reorder parent categories, simply click and drag the category to the desired position. If a parent category contains sub-categories, you can click the    icon on the right to reorder those sub-categories.
The parent categories have been successfully reordered.
To reorder sub-categories, simply click and drag the sub-category to the desired position.
The sub-categories have been successfully reordered.

A custom department field is an additional piece of data you would like to collect from a user who is submitting a ticket to a certain department. For example, if your helpdesk had a "PC Tech Support" department, you might setup a custom text entry field where your users can type in the model of their computer. Later, when viewing a ticket in the "PC Tech Support" department, you would know the model of the user's computer right away.
This except will be displayed on the main page, along with a link to the cdfields item. If you leave this blank, the first 200 characters of the cdfields content will be used.
The custom department field has been successfully updated.
The custom department field has been successfully added.
The custom department fields have been successfully reordered.
The custom department field has been successfully deleted.
There are no custom departments fields. Would you like to add a custom field?
Are you sure you want to delete this custom department field item?
To reorder custom department fields, simply click and drag the field to the desired position.
Are you sure you want to delete this custom department field?

A custom profile field is an additional piece of data you would like to collect from your users. For example, you could create a custom drop-down menu field that would appear in your users' profiles allowing them to select their gender. That field could be set to appear in Ticket View, so the user's gender would be displayed alongside all of the other data in their ticket.
This except will be displayed on the main page, along with a link to the cpfields item. If you leave this blank, the first 200 characters of the cpfields content will be used.
The custom profile field has been successfully updated.
The custom profile field has been successfully added.
The custom profile fields have been successfully reordered.
The custom profile field has been successfully deleted.
There are no custom profiles fields. Would you like to add a custom field?
Are you sure you want to delete this custom profile field item?
To reorder custom profile fields, simply click and drag the field to the desired position.
To show this field on the registration form, select Guests in the permission checkboxes below. Be sure Visible to Staff Only is set to No.
Are you sure you want to delete this custom profile field?
The department has been successfully added.
The department has been successfully updated.
The departments have been successfully reordered.
What would you like to do with the tickets in this department?

Departments are like categories for your support tickets. You can create departments for whatever purposes you'd like (sales, billing, tech support, legal, etc.) and your helpdesk users will be able to select the department they wish to submit their ticket to. You can filter the Ticket List by department, and grant your staff access to tickets in assigned departments only.
There are no departments. Would you like to add a new department?
To reorder departments, simply click and drag the department to the desired position.
Allows user to assign tickets to any staff user (including him/herself).
Allows user to assign tickets to him/herself.
This except will be displayed on the main page, along with a link to the departs item. If you leave this blank, the first 200 characters of the departs content will be used.
Allows user to delete ticket replies.
Allows user to edit ticket replies.
Allows user to edit tickets (includes subject, priority, status, etc).
Allows user to escalate or remove escalated status on tickets.
Allows user to move tickets to a new department.
Allows user to re-open closed tickets.
Allows user to accept, hold, and reply to tickets.
Allows user to view tickets. This does not grant any other permissions such as replying to a ticket.

The global Allow Rating setting under Tickets has been set to No. Therefore, users will not be able to rate until the global setting has been set to Yes. You can change this global setting /admin.php?section=tools&page=settings&act=edit&group=ticket\" target=\"_blank\">here.

The following permissions / settings only apply if ACP Access is granted below.
* If group has ACP Access, permission may be ignored or overridden by the Staff Department Permissions below.

You can assign different permissions to different groups. For example, you can prohibit guests (non-logged-in visitors) from accessing your knowledgebase, and allow your users (logged-in visitors) to rate articles in your knowledgebase but not comment on them.
What would you like to do with the users of this group?

News items are announcements that appear on the front page of your helpdesk. You may wish to post news items about your organizations' policies, service outages, or the hours of availability for your customer support team.
This except will be displayed on the main page, along with a link to the news item. If you leave this blank, the first 200 characters of the news content will be used.

Since you're reading this paragraph right now, it's safe to say that you are a Trellis Desk user. And we want to hear what you, the user, thinks about our software! Please visit the ACCORD5 issue tracker where you can report bugs or suggest any features you'd like to see in future versions of Trellis Desk. Or, if you're not feeling that adventurous, just drop us a message at info@accord5.com. We really want to hear what you think about Trellis Desk!

Settings such as allow members to change skin / language.
Settings for the news system such as RTE support, comments, etc.
Settings that control security features such as session timeouts, IP matching, registration, etc.
General ticket settings such as escalation time.

Skins are a way to personalize the appearance of your helpdesk. Applying a new skin to Trellis Desk will change the style, colors, buttons, and controls presented to your helpdesk users. You can import skins that other people have shared, or you can create graphics and write code to make your own unique skin. For example, you may wish to create your own skin that matches the rest of your organization's website.
WARNING: Trellis Desk will attempt to delete the skin folder including any images, css, templates, etc.

Custom users allow you to display your own content on a new user of your helpdesk. When creating a custom user, you can either type out the content you would like to display, insert your own HTML code, or link the user to an external template.
